be.belgium.eid.eidlib
Class SmartCard

java.lang.Object
  be.belgium.eid.eidlib.SmartCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeID
public class SmartCard
extends java.lang.Object

The SmartCard class contains the different operations that can be performed on a regular (not specifically e-ID related) smart card. It contains more general operations that are more difficult to work with than those of BeID. While the BeID class connects to the smart card implicitly when performing an operation, this class does not do this. Before doing anything, the method connectCard() should be executed.

Version:
1.0.0 07 Dec 2007
Author:
Kristof Overdulve

Constructor Detail

SmartCard

public SmartCard()
Sets up the system. Note that you have to call connect() or connect(name) before being able to perform any operation or retrieve any data from the smart card.

Returns the smart card readers in the current context of the system.

Returns:
a list of smart card readers currently connected to the system
Throws:
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed

connectCard

public void connectCard(java.lang.String name)
                 throws NoReadersFoundException,
                        javax.smartcardio.CardException
Connects the system to the smart card reader with the given name to allow operations to be performed on the smart card. If the card was already connected to the system, nothing will be done.

Parameters:
name - is the name of the smart card reader to connect with
Throws:
NoReadersFoundException - when no card readers were found on the current device
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed

Throws:
NoReadersFoundException - when no card readers were found on the current device

Parameters:

p2 - contains the second parameter to indicate what to read

Parameters:

getCardData

public byte[] getCardData()
                   throws CardNotFoundException,
                          javax.smartcardio.CardException
Returns the card specific data that also contains version information. Even when the card has been removed from the smart card reader and the given parameter is false, the card data is returned from when the connection was made.

Returns:
the card specific data
Throws:
CardNotFoundException - indicates that the card wasn't present in the system or was reset, it could also be that no connection with the smart card has been made yet
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed

getChallenge

public byte[] getChallenge()
                    throws CardNotFoundException,
                           javax.smartcardio.CardException
Returns the challenge for use in a security related procedure such as an external authentication command. This challenge can, for example, be a random number. The challenge-response authentication is a family of protocols in which one party presents the question and another party must provide a valid answer to be authenticated. The easiest example of this protocol is password authentication in which the challenge is the prompt for the password and the response is the right password.

Returns:
the generated challenge
Throws:
CardNotFoundException - indicates that the card wasn't present in the system or was reset, it could also be that no connection with the smart card has been made yet
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed

getChallengeResponse

public byte[] getChallengeResponse(byte[] challenge)
                            throws CardNotFoundException,
                                   javax.smartcardio.CardException
Returns the challenge response for the given generated challenge for use in a security related procedure such as an external authentication command. For more information about the challenge itself see getChallenge().

Parameters:
challenge - is the challenge that was previously generated and for which to generate a response
Returns:
the response for the given generated challenge
Throws:
CardNotFoundException - indicates that the card wasn't present in the system or was reset, it could also be that no connection with the smart card has been made yet
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed

verifyPIN

public int verifyPIN(java.lang.String code)
              throws CardNotFoundException,
                     javax.smartcardio.CardException,
                     WrongPINException,
                     InvalidSWException
Verifies the given PIN code of the PIN with the given reference. Returns the number of times left that the user can attempt to verify the code of the given PIN. Be very careful when using this operation in any kind of loop to avoid any accidental repetition of the input of an invalid PIN. A good idea is to break out of this loop when the number of tries left is 1.

Parameters:
code - is the PIN code with which to verify the operation
Returns:
the number of tries left
Throws:
CardNotFoundException - indicates that the card wasn't present in the system or was reset, it could also be that no connection with the smart card has been made yet
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed
WrongPINException - when the wrong PIN was entered
InvalidSWException - when the status words returned were not expected

changePIN

public int changePIN(java.lang.String oldCode,
                     java.lang.String newCode)
              throws CardNotFoundException,
                     javax.smartcardio.CardException,
                     WrongPINException,
                     InvalidSWException
Changes the PIN code of the PIN. The (given) old code will be changed to the given new code. The function returns the number of times left that the user can attempt to verify the code of the given PIN. Be very careful when using this operation in any kind of loop to avoid any accidental repetition of the input of an invalid PIN. A good idea is to break out of this loop when the number of tries left is 1.

Parameters:
oldCode - is the former PIN code to change
newCode - is the new PIN code to change to
Returns:
the number of tries left
Throws:
CardNotFoundException - indicates that the card wasn't present in the system or was reset, it could also be that no connection with the smart card has been made yet
javax.smartcardio.CardException - if the card operation failed
WrongPINException - when the wrong PIN was entered
InvalidSWException - when the status words returned were not expected

reactivate

public void reactivate(java.lang.String citizen,
                       java.lang.String government)
                throws CardNotFoundException,
                       javax.smartcardio.CardException,
                       InvalidSWException
Reactivates the card by the given two PUK codes. After this, the PINs can be entered again. TODO Can't really test this because i don't have any test cards and I don't know the municipality PUK code

Parameters:
citizen - contains the citizen PUK code
government - contains the government PUK code
Throws:
javax.smartcardio.CardException - when a card related exception occurred
CardNotFoundException - when the card was not present
InvalidSWException - when the reactivation failed and the status words were invalid
